Authorization for Native Apps

Ian Lyttle

2017-04-28

library("AzureOAuth")
library("httr")

This will work better with screeshots of how to set up a native app on the Azure side of things.

endpoint <- oauth_endpoint_azure(tenant_id = Sys.getenv("azure_tenant_id"))
## <oauth_endpoint>
##  authorize: https://login.microsoftonline.com/aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeeeeeee/oauth2/authorize
##  access:    https://login.microsoftonline.com/aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeeeeeee/oauth2/token
app <- oauth_app(
  appname = Sys.getenv("azure_native_application_name"),
  key = Sys.getenv("azure_native_application_id"),
  secret = NULL
)
## <oauth_app> not_needed_but_can_be_useful
##   key:    ffffffff-gggg-hhhh-iiii-jjjjjjjjjjjj
##   secret: <not supplied>
token <- oauth2.0_token(
  endpoint = endpoint, 
  app = app,
  user_params = list(resource = "https://management.core.windows.net/"),
  use_oob = FALSE
)

Let’s wrap this in some syntactic sugar:
